summary: The document is a confidential FBI memorandum from October 28, 1964, concerning the President's Commission on the Assassination of President Kennedy. It details a Spanish-language letter received by the American Embassy in Spain, which alleges the possession of a document harmful to President Johnson, purportedly taken from the Warren Commission. The letter, signed by Ant sofean S., offers the document for sale to the Director of 'Paris-Match' and mentions involvement from an individual at the UK Embassy in Paris. The FBI's Paris Office has initiated an investigation by referring the matter to the High General Staff in Madrid to identify the sender and collect further information.
key_findings: The document is related to the investigation into the assassination of President Kennedy.
A Spanish-language letter claims the existence of a document that could be damaging to President Johnson, possibly stolen from the Warren Commission.
The FBI is working with international agencies to probe the allegations in the letter.
The letter hints at an attempt to sell the alleged document to a media outlet, involving international entities.
